text: I see that we're using Git for version control. How do I document code changes when I make updates or fixes? Good question. When you make changes, you should use descriptive commit messages. Start your message with a verb in the imperative form like fix, add, or update followed by a brief description of what you did. That sounds straightforward. Anything else I should keep in mind? You should also reference issues in your commit message if you're working on a task related to an issue. It helps in tracking progress and understanding the context of changes. Thanks for the clarification. I'll make sure to follow these steps.
